sentence.Network_en: She really could not touch upon such an indelicate subject.
sentence.Network_cn: 她实在不想触碰如此令人窘迫的话题。

sentence.Network_en: To the unconsciously indelicate person, all things are delicate.
sentence.Network_cn: 在有伤大雅而自己并不觉得的人看来, 什么事情都是无伤大雅的.

sentence.Network_en: He had flung a leg of lamb at some indelicate disturbing tutor.
sentence.Network_cn: 他曾经在那儿把一只羊腿扔到一个粗鄙惹人的导师的身上.

entry.tran: 粗野的;无礼的;令人窘迫的
entry.def: If something or someone is indelicate, they are rude or embarrassing.

example.ex: She really could not touch upon such an indelicate subject.
example.tran: 她实在不想触碰如此令人窘迫的话题。

means.word_mean: 1. in violation of good taste even verging on the indecent;
2. lacking propriety and good taste in manners and conduct;

auth_sentence.content: Darwin was not so indelicate as to specify how some individuals were exterminated.
